segments.text: I glance at the overflowing sink again, water cascading down like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of irritation bubbling up inside me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman be so oblivious to the chaos that’s literally at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is supposed to be a safe space, yet it looks like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder if she’s really so focused on her dishes or if she’s just tuning everything else out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each drop of water on the cabinet feels like a reminder of her negligence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shake her out of her trance and point out the mess, but I keep watching instead.
segments.speaker: PAR
